Constructs a {{tt|month_day}}.

@1@ Default constructor leaves the stored month and day values uninitialized.
@2@ Constructs a {{tt|month_day}} that stores the month {{c|m}} and the day {{c|d}}.

===Notes===
A more convenient way to construct a {{tt|month_day}} is with {{c|operator/}}, e.g., {{c|std::chrono::April/1}}. 

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    using namespace std::chrono_literals;
    constexpr auto mo_da = std::chrono::month_day(std::chrono::February, 29d);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;unsigned&gt;(mo_da.day()) &lt;&lt; '/' 
              &lt;&lt; static_cast&lt;unsigned&gt;(mo_da.month()) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=29/2
}}
